title: Implement daemon process architecture
description:
## Summary
Implement the background daemon process that manages worker lifecycle.

## Requirements
- Daemon process that runs in background
- PID file management for daemon tracking
- Signal handling (SIGTERM, SIGINT) for clean shutdown
- Daemon start/stop/restart functionality
- Status checking (is daemon running?)
- Logging to file for daemon activity

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `mab start` launches daemon in background
- [ ] `mab stop` cleanly shuts down daemon
- [ ] `mab status` shows daemon state
- [ ] PID file created/cleaned up properly
- [ ] Daemon survives terminal close

## Labels
dev, architecture
close_reason: Daemon process architecture implemented with CLI integration. Commit 043fc35.

title: [Bug] Workers crash before claiming beads - no work executed
description:
## Problem
Workers spawned via dashboard crash repeatedly before they can claim any beads.

## Evidence
- Worker `worker-dev-0f96fb4f` spawned via dashboard
- Worker showed RUNNING status initially (PID 65240)
- Worker crashed and auto-restarted 4 times in ~6 minutes
- No `claude.log` created in worker worktree
- Test bead `multi_agent_beads-3fyc4` was never claimed

## Timeline
1. Spawned worker via dashboard - status RUNNING
2. After 30 seconds - still RUNNING (TC4 pass)
3. After 60 seconds - status changed to CRASHED
4. Auto-restart kicked in - new PID assigned
5. Crash/restart cycle repeated 4 times
6. After 2+ minutes - bead still unclaimed

## What Works (PR #29 fix verified)
- Workers get assigned PIDs (not immediately defunct)
- Workers show RUNNING status briefly
- Auto-restart feature works correctly
- This proves the --print to -p flag fix is working

## Root Cause Theory
Workers start successfully but crash before entering the work loop. Possible causes:
1. Worker prompt file missing or malformed
2. Environment variable issue
3. Claude CLI error during initialization
4. Permission or path issue in worktree

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Start dashboard: `mab dashboard`
2. Navigate to http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin
3. Start daemon (click Start button)
4. Spawn Developer worker
5. Observe worker crashes repeatedly

## Investigation Needed
1. Check worker stderr (not just claude.log)
2. Run claude CLI manually with worker prompt
3. Check for missing configuration
4. Review spawner.py process lifecycle

## Related
- Discovered during: multi_agent_beads-hti5l (QA verification)
- Test bead: multi_agent_beads-3fyc4 (close as artifact)
close_reason: PR #31 merged, CI passed - symlinked .beads directory in worktrees to fix stale database issue

title: Dashboard shows 95 active agents - overly broad activity tracking
description: The agents page shows ~95 active agents when only a few are actually running. Root cause: lines 146-148 in agents.py treat ANY log entry (including NO_WORK polls) as activity, keeping stale agents marked active indefinitely.
close_reason: Already fixed in commit ed3c8d5 (PR #54) - NO_WORK events now filtered from activity tracking at lines 146-162

title: Create Web Admin UI base structure
description:
## Summary
Build the foundational web admin UI for managing the orchestration system.

## Requirements
- FastAPI/Flask web server integrated with daemon
- Basic dashboard layout (header, sidebar, main content)
- REST API endpoints for worker management
- WebSocket support for real-time updates
- Static file serving for frontend assets
- Authentication placeholder (can be basic for MVP)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Web UI accessible at configured port
- [ ] Dashboard shows system overview
- [ ] API endpoints documented
- [ ] WebSocket connection established
- [ ] Responsive design works on desktop

## Dependencies
Depends on: daemon architecture

## Labels
dev, frontend
close_reason: Superseded by multi_agent_beads-6jnj - integrating into existing dashboard instead of creating new UI

title: [Bug] Workers don't claim available beads - needs investigation
description:
## Problem
QA test (multi_agent_beads-i18a7) found that spawned workers do NOT claim available beads.

## Evidence
- 5 workers spawned and RUNNING (verified via ps aux and API)
- Test bead multi_agent_beads-7518n created and available in bd ready -l dev
- Workers ran for 3+ minutes but NEVER claimed the bead
- No CLAIM event in logs from any spawned worker

## From QA Report:
> Workers running but not claiming the test bead during observation window
> Possible Causes:
> - Worker polling interval not reached
> - Worker internal state not yet polling for work
> - Configuration difference between spawned workers and expected behavior

## Expected Behavior
Workers should poll bd ready and claim available beads matching their role filter.

## Found By
QA Test: multi_agent_beads-i18a7 (workflow_v2)
close_reason: PR #27 merged - fix workers not claiming beads due to stale worktree .beads data

title: Deprecate claude.log parsing for agent monitoring
description:
## Task
Remove the log-parsing code from dashboard agent monitoring.

## Changes

### dashboard/routes/agents.py
- Remove _parse_log_file()
- Remove _extract_agents_from_logs()
- Remove PID-based tracking logic
- Keep only mab.db-based queries

### dashboard/routes/logs.py
- Keep log streaming for activity view (optional)
- Or remove entirely if per-worker logs are sufficient

### PROMPT.md
- Update log() function to use SESSION_ID instead of $$
- Or remove logging instructions entirely if agents use structured events

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] No more PID-based agent tracking
- [ ] Agent monitoring purely from mab.db
- [ ] Old parsing code removed
- [ ] Tests updated
close_reason: Acceptance criteria already met by PR #64 (multi_agent_beads-5h4w3). agents.py uses only mab.db, no log-parsing functions remain, all 23 tests pass.

title: Add favicon for dashboard browser tab
description:
## Problem
Dashboard has no favicon - shows generic browser icon in tab.

## Requirements
- Create a cool icon representing multi-agent beads system
- Ideas: 
  - Beads/circles connected (like a workflow)
  - Multiple agents/robots working together
  - Kanban board icon
  - 'MAB' stylized letters
- Sizes needed: 16x16, 32x32, 180x180 (apple-touch-icon)
- Format: .ico or .png with multiple sizes

## Implementation
1. Create/source icon (SVG preferred for scaling)
2. Generate favicon.ico with multiple sizes
3. Add to dashboard/static/favicon.ico
4. Add link tags to base template:
```html
<link rel="icon" type="image/x-icon" href="/static/favicon.ico">
<link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="/static/apple-touch-icon.png">
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Favicon visible in browser tab
- Looks good at small sizes (16x16)
- Represents the MAB system visually
close_reason: Favicon implemented and pushed to master (5b5284f). Includes SVG, ICO, PNG variants and apple-touch-icon.

title: Tests: Full-stack API integration tests
description:
## Objective
Create full-stack integration tests that exercise the complete API layer with real database operations.

## Scope
- Test all REST API endpoints end-to-end
- Verify database state changes
- Test error handling and edge cases
- Test concurrent operations

## Test Scenarios
1. CRUD operations on beads via API
2. Dependency management (add/remove deps, cycle detection)
3. Bulk operations (close multiple, batch update)
4. Search and filtering endpoints
5. Stats and reporting endpoints
6. Error responses (404, 400, validation errors)
7. Concurrent access handling

## Files to Create
- tests/integration/test_api_fullstack.py
- tests/integration/test_concurrent_access.py
- tests/integration/conftest.py (test fixtures, temp database)

## Requirements
- Use pytest with httpx or requests
- Isolated test database per test run
- Clean setup/teardown

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All API endpoints covered
- [ ] Edge cases tested
- [ ] Concurrent access tested
- [ ] Tests are isolated and repeatable
close_reason: Commit 9dd9a86: Full-stack API integration tests - 57 tests covering API endpoints, concurrent access, error handling. No git remote for PR.

title: Scripts: Create monitor.py terminal monitor
description:
## Objective
Create terminal-based monitoring script.

## File to Create
- scripts/monitor.py

## Features
- Poll bd list every 10 seconds
- Group beads by status
- Show agent assignments
- Display recent log entries
- Clear screen between updates

## Display Format
============================================================
MULTI-AGENT STATUS - 14:30:00
============================================================

[DEVELOPER]
  mab-abc123: Implement login endpoint (45m)
  mab-def456: Fix validation bug (12m)

[QA]
  mab-ghi789: QA: Login flow (5m)

------------------------------------------------------------
RECENT ACTIVITY
------------------------------------------------------------
  14:29:55 [developer-1] CLAIM: mab-abc123
  14:28:30 [qa-1] CLOSE: mab-xyz999

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Updates automatically
- [ ] Shows all active work
- [ ] Easy to read in terminal

title: Dashboard: Display worker worktree location and status
description:
## Context
All agent roles (dev, qa, reviewer, tech_lead, manager) run in isolated git worktrees by default.

Each worker gets:
- Worktree at `.worktrees/worker-{role}-{id}/`
- Branch: `worker/worker-{role}-{id}`
- Symlink to main `.beads/` database

## Feature Request
Display worktree information in the dashboard:

1. **Agents page** - Show worktree path for each worker
2. **Worker details** - Show:
   - Worktree location
   - Branch name
   - Working directory
   - Whether worktree is active/stale

3. **Admin page** - Add worktree management:
   - List all worktrees
   - Cleanup stale worktrees
   - View worktree disk usage

## Technical Notes
- Worktree info stored in `workers.db`: `worktree_path`, `worktree_branch`
- Already tracked in spawner, just not displayed in UI

## Files
- `dashboard/templates/agents.html` - Add worktree display
- `dashboard/routes/agents.py` - Include worktree in response
- `dashboard/templates/admin.html` - Add worktree management section
close_reason: PR #72 merged - added worktree display to dashboard agents and admin pages

title: Single global worker database scalability bottleneck
description: Architectural concern: All workers across all projects share a single SQLite database at ~/.mab/workers.db. SQLite uses file-level locking, so concurrent writes from multiple daemons/workers will serialize, creating contention. Impact: Performance degrades as worker count increases, especially with auto-restart churn. Design improvement: Consider per-project databases or switch to a multi-writer database.
close_reason: PR #53 merged - Added per-project database isolation and WAL mode for better scalability

title: Implement mab init command
description:
## Summary
Create the `mab init` command that initializes agent orchestration in any repository.

## Requirements
- Detect if folder is a git repo (warn if not)
- Create `.mab/` configuration directory
- Generate default config file (mab.yaml or similar)
- Store town configuration (port, worker settings)
- Integrate with existing beads setup if present

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `mab init` creates .mab/ directory
- [ ] Config file generated with sensible defaults
- [ ] Works in any folder (not just this project)
- [ ] Detects existing beads setup
- [ ] Re-running init doesn't destroy config

## Dependencies
Depends on: CLI framework, RPC layer

## Labels
dev
close_reason: Implemented mab init command with templates (default/minimal/full), git detection, beads integration, and force flag. Commit dad660e.

title: Backend: Spawner reads workflow config for agent handoffs
description:
## Scope
Update spawner to inject workflow config into agent environment so agents know handoff chain.

## Changes
```python
# In spawner.py, add to worker env:
env["TOWN_TEMPLATE"] = town.template  # "solo", "pair", "full"
env["TOWN_WORKFLOW"] = json.dumps(town.workflow)  # ["dev", "qa", "human_merge"]
env["NEXT_HANDOFF"] = get_next_handoff(role, town.workflow)  # "qa" or "human_merge"
```

## New CLI Helper
```bash
# Agents can query their next handoff
mab town workflow --current=dev --next
# Returns: "qa" or "human_merge" based on template
```

## Files
- `mab/spawner.py` - Inject workflow env vars
- `mab/cli.py` - Add `town workflow` command
- `mab/towns.py` - get_next_handoff() helper

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Workers have TOWN_TEMPLATE in environment
- [ ] Workers have NEXT_HANDOFF in environment
- [ ] `mab town workflow --current=dev --next` returns correct value

## Dependencies
- Depends on: multi_agent_beads-5aupj (template definitions)

title: Bug: Dashboard doesn't release port on Ctrl+C shutdown
description:
## Problem
When pressing Ctrl+C to stop dashboard, port 8000 is not released properly.
User sees 'Waiting for connections to close' but port stays bound.
Subsequent start fails with 'Address already in use'.

## Root Cause
- Uvicorn reloader spawns child process
- Ctrl+C may not propagate to child
- WebSocket connections may not close cleanly
- Shutdown handler not cleaning up properly

## Fix Required
1. Add proper signal handlers (SIGINT, SIGTERM)
2. Close WebSocket connections on shutdown
3. Ensure child processes are terminated
4. Add graceful shutdown timeout then force kill

## Workaround
```bash
lsof -ti:8000 | xargs kill -9
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Ctrl+C cleanly stops dashboard
- Port released immediately
- No zombie processes left behind
close_reason: PR #2 merged, CI passed. Graceful shutdown implemented with signal handlers for WebSocket connections.

title: Implement multi-town isolation and routing
description:
## Objective
Enable running multiple isolated towns simultaneously.

## Requirements
- Each town has:
  - Unique port
  - Separate worker pool
  - Isolated beads context (different repo)
  - Independent logs

## Implementation
- Town registry in daemon state
- Port allocation and conflict detection
- Worker-to-town association
- Routing in web UI to correct town

## Data Model
```python
class Town:
    id: str
    port: int
    repo_path: str
    status: TownStatus
    workers: List[WorkerId]
    created_at: datetime
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Can create 3+ towns on different ports
- [ ] Workers isolated to their town's repo
- [ ] No cross-contamination of beads data
- [ ] UI shows all towns with switch capability
close_reason: Added town switcher UI to navigation bar. All acceptance criteria met: towns can be created/listed via API, workers are isolated by town_name, beads are isolated by project_path, and UI now shows all towns with switch capability.

title: Create portable CLI package structure (mab command)
description:
## Objective
Create a globally installable CLI tool `mab` (multi-agent beads) that works from any directory.

## Implementation
- Package structure for `pip install mab` or `uv tool install mab`
- Entry point: `mab` command
- Subcommands:
  - `mab init` - Initialize in current repo
  - `mab daemon start|stop|status`
  - `mab town create|list|stop`
  - `mab worker spawn|list|stop`
  - `mab ui` - Open web dashboard

## Technical Decisions
- Use Click or Typer for CLI framework
- pyproject.toml with proper entry points
- Cross-platform support (macOS, Linux, Windows)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Can install globally with pip/uv
- [ ] `mab --help` shows all commands
- [ ] Works from any directory
- [ ] Finds nearest `.beads/` or creates one
close_reason: Duplicate - superseded by multi_agent_beads-6ly3 with proper dependency chain

title: BUG: Health API response field mismatch causes 500 error
description:
## Problem
GET /api/workers/health returns 500 Internal Server Error

## Root Cause
Field name mismatch between RPC response and Pydantic model:

**RPC returns:**
- healthy_workers, unhealthy_workers, crashed_workers
- config.health_check_interval_seconds

**Response model expects:**
- healthy_count, unhealthy_count, crashed_count
- health_check_interval, max_restart_count

## Fix
Update HealthStatusResponse in dashboard/routes/workers.py to match actual RPC response:

```python
class HealthStatusResponse(BaseModel):
    healthy_workers: int  # was healthy_count
    unhealthy_workers: int  # was unhealthy_count
    crashed_workers: int  # was crashed_count
    total_restarts: int
    workers_at_max_restarts: int
    config: dict  # nested config object
```

Or transform the response in the endpoint.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] GET /api/workers/health returns 200
- [ ] Response matches actual daemon output
close_reason: Fix committed (e0994e3): aligned HealthStatusResponse model with RPC response fields

title: Bug: Spawned agents show 'unknown' role, Tech Lead invalid
description:
## Problems
1. When spawning agents via web UI, they show as 'unknown' role
2. Tech Lead role option fails - says invalid agent

## Evidence
- User spawns Developer  shows 'unknown' 
- User tries Tech Lead  error 'invalid agent'

## Likely Causes
1. Role not being passed correctly from form to API
2. Role mapping mismatch between frontend dropdown values and backend expected values
3. Tech Lead may be 'tech_lead' in backend but 'Tech Lead' in dropdown

## Debug Steps
1. Check admin.html dropdown values vs API expected values
2. Check spawn_worker endpoint role parameter handling
3. Check spawner.py ROLE_TO_PROMPT mapping

## Frontend dropdown values (admin.html):
- Developer, QA, Reviewer, Tech Lead, Manager

## Backend expected (spawner.py):
- dev, qa, reviewer, tech_lead, manager

## Fix Required
- Map frontend display names to backend role codes
- Or update dropdown values to match backend expectations

## Acceptance Criteria
- All roles spawn correctly
- Spawned workers show correct role name
- Tech Lead works
close_reason: PR #1 merged: Fixed Tech Lead role mapping from tech-lead to tech_lead in admin dropdowns

title: [QA] Full E2E verification after PR #35 - BD_ROOT env var fix
description:
## Purpose
Verify that PR #35 fix (BD_ROOT env var + symlink improvements) allows workers to claim and execute beads.

## USE CHROME MCP FOR ALL TESTING

## Test Cases

### Phase 1: Clean Environment
#### TC01: Stop All Workers
- mab stop --all
- take_screenshot: TC01_clean_state.png
- **PASS/FAIL**: No workers running

#### TC02: Restart Daemon (load new code)
- mab restart
- take_screenshot: TC02_daemon_restarted.png
- **PASS/FAIL**: Daemon running with new PID

#### TC03: Dashboard Access
- navigate_page: http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin
- take_screenshot: TC03_dashboard.png
- **PASS/FAIL**: Dashboard loads

### Phase 2: Spawn All 5 Worker Roles
#### TC04: Spawn Developer
- take_screenshot: TC04_dev_spawned.png

### Phase 3: Worker Persistence
#### TC10: Wait 60 Seconds
- Wait 60 seconds
- take_screenshot: TC10_workers_persist.png
- **PASS/FAIL**: All workers still RUNNING (not crashed)

#### TC11: Check Worker Logs
- navigate_page to logs section
- take_screenshot: TC11_worker_logs.png

### Phase 4: Bead Creation
#### TC12: Create Test Bead via Dashboard
- Click New Bead
- title='[Test] PR #35 verification bead'
- type=task, priority=P1, labels=dev
- take_screenshot: TC12_bead_created.png

- **PASS/FAIL**: Bead created successfully

### Phase 5: Worker Claims Bead (CRITICAL)

#### TC18: Final State Check

## Evidence Directory
tests/e2e/evidence/pr35_verification/
- TC01.png through TC18.png
- Summary.md with pass/fail table

## Pass Criteria
ALL test cases must PASS, especially:
- TC09: All 5 workers running
- TC10: Workers persist 60s
- **TC13: Bead claimed (CRITICAL)**
- TC17: Bead closed

## IF ANY CRITICAL TC FAILS
```bash
bd create --title="[Bug] PR #35 verification failed: <TC number and reason>" --type=bug --priority=0 --labels=dev
```

## Success = Full System Verified
When TC01-TC18 all PASS:
- Worker spawning 
- Worker persistence 
- BD_ROOT env var working 
- Bead claiming 
- Work execution 
- Bead completion 

## Cleanup
- Close test bead if not claimed
- Stop all test workers

title: Add 'mab dashboard' CLI command with global installation
description:
## Problem
Currently dashboard requires: `uv run python -m dashboard.app`
User wants: `mab dashboard` from any directory

## Requirements

### CLI Command
Add `mab dashboard` command to mab/cli.py:
```bash
mab dashboard              # Start for current project, auto-assign port
mab dashboard --port 8001  # Specific port
mab dashboard --stop       # Stop dashboard for current project
mab dashboard --status     # Show running dashboards
```

### Multi-project Support
- Each project gets its own dashboard instance
- Auto-assign ports: 8000, 8001, 8002... based on project
- Store port mapping in ~/.mab/dashboards.json
- Dashboard scoped to project directory (only shows that project's beads/workers)

### Background Daemon
- Run dashboard as background process
- PID file at ~/.mab/dashboard-<project-hash>.pid
- Logs at ~/.mab/logs/dashboard-<project>.log

### Create docs/INSTALLATION.md
Document:
1. Quick install (uv tool install)
2. Manual install (pip install)
3. Development install
4. Verify installation
5. Shell completion setup
6. Uninstall instructions

## Installation Methods to Document

### Quick Install (Recommended)
```bash
# Install globally with uv
uv tool install git+https://github.com/USER/multi_agent_beads.git

# Or from local clone
cd multi_agent_beads
uv tool install .

# Verify
mab --version
mab dashboard --help
```

### pip Install
```bash
pip install git+https://github.com/USER/multi_agent_beads.git
# or
pip install -e /path/to/multi_agent_beads
```

### Development Install
```bash
git clone <repo>
cd multi_agent_beads
uv sync
uv run mab --help
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `mab dashboard` starts dashboard for current project
- [ ] Multiple dashboards can run on different ports
- [ ] `mab dashboard --stop` cleanly stops dashboard
- [ ] docs/INSTALLATION.md created with all install methods
- [ ] Works after `uv tool install .`
close_reason: Commit 655b087 - Added mab dashboard command with multi-project support. Tests pass, lint clean. No git remote configured for PR.

title: Backend: Define team templates (solo/pair/full) and database schema
description:
## Scope
Define the three team templates and update database schema.

## Templates Definition
```python
TEMPLATES = {
    "solo": {
        "roles": {"dev": 1},
        "workflow": ["dev", "human_merge"],
    },
    "pair": {
        "roles": {"dev": 1, "qa": 1},
        "workflow": ["dev", "qa", "human_merge"],
    },
    "full": {
        "roles": {"manager": 1, "tech_lead": 1, "dev": 1, "qa": 1, "reviewer": 1},
        "workflow": ["manager", "tech_lead", "dev", "qa", "reviewer", "done"],
    },
}
```

## Database Schema Changes
```sql
-- workers.db
ALTER TABLE towns ADD COLUMN template TEXT DEFAULT 'pair';
ALTER TABLE towns ADD COLUMN workflow TEXT;  -- JSON array
ALTER TABLE towns ADD COLUMN worker_counts TEXT;  -- JSON: {"dev": 2, "qa": 1}
```

## Files
- `mab/templates.py` - New file with template definitions
- `mab/db.py` - Schema migration for towns table
- `mab/towns.py` - Load/validate templates

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Templates defined with roles and workflow
- [ ] Database schema updated
- [ ] Migration runs cleanly
- [ ] Unit tests for template validation

title: [QA] Test spawning ALL agent types via Admin UI with Chrome MCP
description:
## Objective
As a Senior QA Engineer, use Chrome MCP tools to test that ALL agent types can be spawned via the Admin page UI.

## Prerequisites
1. Start dashboard: uv run python -m uvicorn dashboard.app:app --host 127.0.0.1 --port 8000 &
2. Ensure daemon is running (start via UI if needed)

## Test Cases

### TC1: Spawn Developer Agent
1. Navigate to http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin
2. take_snapshot to find spawn form elements
3. Select 'dev' from role dropdown
4. Click 'Spawn Worker' button
5. VERIFY: Toast/success message appears
6. VERIFY: Worker appears in workers list with status 'running'
7. VERIFY: Worker has a PID assigned
8. Create bug bead if FAILS

### TC2: Spawn QA Agent
1. Select 'qa' from role dropdown
2. Click 'Spawn Worker'
3. VERIFY: QA worker spawns and shows in list
4. Create bug bead if FAILS

### TC3: Spawn Reviewer Agent
1. Select 'reviewer' from role dropdown
2. Click 'Spawn Worker'
3. VERIFY: Reviewer worker spawns and shows in list
4. Create bug bead if FAILS

### TC4: Spawn Tech Lead Agent
1. Select 'tech-lead' from role dropdown
2. Click 'Spawn Worker'
3. VERIFY: Tech Lead worker spawns and shows in list
4. Create bug bead if FAILS

### TC5: Spawn Manager Agent
1. Select 'manager' from role dropdown
2. Click 'Spawn Worker'
3. VERIFY: Manager worker spawns and shows in list
4. Create bug bead if FAILS

### TC6: Verify All 5 Agents Running
1. take_snapshot of workers list
2. VERIFY: All 5 agents visible (dev, qa, reviewer, tech-lead, manager)
3. VERIFY: All show 'running' status
4. Navigate to /agents page
5. VERIFY: All 5 agents appear there too

### TC7: Stop Agent via UI
1. Click 'Stop' button on one worker
2. VERIFY: Worker status changes to 'stopped'
3. Create bug bead if FAILS

### TC8: Restart Agent via UI  
1. Click 'Restart' button on a worker
2. VERIFY: Worker restarts with new PID
3. Create bug bead if FAILS

## Bug Reporting
For EACH failure, immediately create:
bd create --title='[Dashboard Bug] Agent spawn: <issue>' --type=bug --priority=2

## Chrome MCP Tools to Use
- mcp__chrome-devtools__navigate_page
- mcp__chrome-devtools__take_snapshot
- mcp__chrome-devtools__click
- mcp__chrome-devtools__fill
- mcp__chrome-devtools__list_console_messages (check for JS errors)

## Cleanup
Stop all workers, then: pkill -f 'uvicorn dashboard.app:app'
close_reason: QA testing complete via Chrome MCP. TC1-TC6 PASSED: All 5 agent types spawn and appear in UI. TC7 partial (stop dialog works). TC8 skipped (Chrome MCP timeout). No code changes needed - this was a QA verification task.

title: Update dashboard /api/agents to read from mab.db
description:
## Task
Replace log-parsing agent monitoring with mab.db queries.

## Changes to dashboard/routes/agents.py

### Replace _extract_agents_from_logs() with:
```python
def _get_workers_from_db() -> list[dict]:
    """Get worker state from mab.db."""
    db_path = PROJECT_ROOT / ".mab" / "mab.db"
    if not db_path.exists():
        return []
    
    conn = sqlite3.connect(db_path)
    conn.row_factory = sqlite3.Row
    
    workers = conn.execute("""
        SELECT w.*, 
               (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM worker_events e 
                WHERE e.worker_id = w.id AND e.event_type = 'claim') as beads_claimed
        FROM workers w
        WHERE w.status IN ('running', 'spawning')
           OR w.stopped_at > datetime('now', '-1 hour')
        ORDER BY w.started_at DESC
    """).fetchall()
    
    return [dict(w) for w in workers]
```

### Update get_agents() endpoint:
- Read from mab.db instead of parsing logs
- Include recent stopped workers (last hour)
- Add proper status field from DB

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] /api/agents returns workers from mab.db
- [ ] Shows running workers correctly
- [ ] Shows recently stopped workers
- [ ] No more log parsing for agent state
close_reason: PR #64 merged, CI passed - /api/agents now reads from mab.db instead of parsing logs

title: E2E Chrome test: Verify mab.db agent monitoring works end-to-end
description:
## Task
Run full E2E Chrome MCP tests to verify the new mab.db-backed agent monitoring works correctly.

## Test Scenarios

### 1. Dashboard shows 0 agents initially
- Navigate to /agents
- Verify empty state

### 2. Spawn a worker via dashboard
- Go to /admin
- Fill spawn form (role: dev)
- Click spawn
- Verify worker appears in mab.db
- Verify worker shows on /agents page

### 3. View worker logs
- Click "View Logs" for spawned worker
- Verify log streaming from .mab/logs/<worker-id>.log

### 4. Stop worker
- Stop the worker
- Verify status updates to "stopped" in mab.db
- Verify /agents shows stopped state

### 5. Verify no log parsing
- Check that agent state comes from mab.db NOT claude.log parsing

## How to Run
```bash
# Start dashboard
uv run uvicorn dashboard.app:app --host 127.0.0.1 --port 8000

# Run Chrome MCP tests
uv run pytest tests/e2e/test_chrome_mcp_e2e.py -v

# Or use Chrome MCP directly
# navigate_page, take_snapshot, click, fill, etc.
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Dashboard shows workers from mab.db
- [ ] Spawn creates worker in mab.db
- [ ] View Logs streams from per-worker file
- [ ] Stop updates mab.db status

title: Implement multi-town support
description:
## Summary
Enable running multiple independent orchestration "towns" on different ports.

## Requirements
- Town configuration in mab.yaml
- Unique port per town
- Isolated worker pools per town
- Town creation/deletion commands
- Town switching in CLI and UI
- Cross-town visibility in master dashboard
- Resource isolation between towns

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Can create multiple towns
- [ ] Each town runs on its own port
- [ ] Workers are isolated per town
- [ ] UI shows all towns
- [ ] Can switch between towns
- [ ] 3+ towns can run simultaneously

## Dependencies
Depends on: mab init, worker controls

## Labels
dev, architecture
close_reason: Implemented multi-town support with town model, CLI commands, and dashboard API. Commit 88e6d98.

comments.author: mark.johnson
comments.text:
## Clarification: Port Model with Hybrid Approach

With the hybrid daemon architecture:
- **Global daemon** (~/.mab/mab.sock) - ONE per user, manages all towns
- **Per-town dashboard** - Each town can have its own dashboard on a different port

Port usage:
- Daemon RPC: Unix socket (no port needed)
- Dashboard UI: HTTP port per town (e.g., :8000, :8001, :8002)

This means:
1. User can run dashboards for multiple repos simultaneously
2. Each dashboard connects to the same global daemon
3. Dashboard shows only workers for its town (filtered by project path)

Example:
```bash
# In ~/projects/frontend
mab ui --port 8000  # Dashboard for frontend town

# In ~/projects/backend  
mab ui --port 8001  # Dashboard for backend town
```

Both dashboards talk to the same daemon at ~/.mab/mab.sock

title: Integrate mab worker controls into existing dashboard
description:
## Summary
Add mab worker management to the existing FastAPI dashboard rather than creating a separate admin UI.

## Context
User decision: Extend existing dashboard (easiest approach) rather than create new admin app.

## Requirements
- Add new /admin route to existing dashboard
- Admin page shows:
  - Daemon status (connected to global daemon at ~/.mab/)
  - Current town (based on dashboard's project path)
  - Worker list with spawn/stop controls
  - Role selector dropdown
  - Instance count input
- Reuse existing dashboard patterns:
  - HTMX for reactive updates
  - TailwindCSS styling
  - Jinja2 templates
  - SSE for real-time updates

## Changes to Existing Dashboard
- dashboard/routes/admin.py (new)
- dashboard/templates/admin/*.html (new)
- dashboard/services/mab.py (new) - RPC client to daemon
- Update dashboard/app.py to include admin routes

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] /admin route accessible in existing dashboard
- [ ] Shows daemon connection status
- [ ] Can spawn workers by role
- [ ] Can stop workers
- [ ] Real-time status via SSE
- [ ] Consistent styling with existing dashboard
close_reason: All acceptance criteria met. Admin UI fully implemented with daemon status, worker spawn/stop controls, and SSE log streaming. 88 tests pass, linting clean.

title: [Bug] Worker processes crash repeatedly before claiming beads
description:
## Problem
Workers are spawning but crashing repeatedly before they can claim any beads.

## Evidence
- Spawned worker-dev-f2b9b663 via dashboard
- Worker shows RUNNING status but crash_count increases (0 -> 3)
- PID changes indicate daemon keeps restarting worker
- No claude.log written in worktree
- bd ready from worktree DOES show available beads
- Bead not claimed within 90 seconds

## Key Finding
This is NOT the .beads sync issue - that fix (PR #33) is working. Beads ARE visible from worktree. Workers just crash before claiming.

## Observed Process
- Worker starts with Claude CLI + PROMPT.md content
- Worker appears to crash shortly after starting
- Dashboard shows Healthy: 0, Unhealthy: 1

## Needs Investigation
- Why workers crash after spawn
- Check Claude CLI exit codes
- Check if PROMPT.md or prompt length causes issues
- Verify worktree setup is complete before Claude starts
close_reason: PR #34 merged - Fixed worker crash detection for clean exits

title: Create mab CLI tool framework
description:
## Summary
Create the foundational CLI framework for the `mab` (multi-agent beads) command-line tool.

## Requirements
- Create CLI entry point using Click or Typer
- Implement subcommand structure: `mab init`, `mab start`, `mab stop`, `mab status`
- Add version command and help text
- Set up pyproject.toml for global installation via pipx/uv tool install
- Create package structure under `mab/` directory

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `mab --help` shows available commands
- [ ] `mab --version` shows version
- [ ] Package installable globally
- [ ] CLI structure supports future subcommands

## Labels
dev, architecture

title: Add Create Bead form to admin dashboard
description:
## Summary
Add a UI form to create new beads from the /admin dashboard.

## Current State
- API exists: POST /api/beads
- No UI form to use it
- Users must use CLI: bd create

## Requirements
- "New Bead" button on admin page
- Modal form with fields:
  - Title (required)
  - Description (textarea, markdown)
  - Type (task/bug/feature/epic)
  - Priority (0-4 dropdown)
  - Labels (multi-select or tags)
- Submit creates bead via API
- Success toast notification
- Bead appears in list immediately

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] "New Bead" button visible on /admin
- [ ] Form validates required fields
- [ ] Created beads appear in dashboard
- [ ] Agents can pick up UI-created beads
close_reason: Committed locally: b3096df - feat(dashboard): add Create Bead form to admin page. No git remote configured for PR.

title: BUG: Dashboard shows phantom active agents when none running
description:
## Problem
Agent sidebar shows active agents even when no workers are spawned.

## Likely Cause
- Stale data in claude.log being parsed
- No filtering by recent timestamp
- SESSION_END not clearing agent from display

## Fix
- Only show agents with activity in last N minutes
- Clear agent when SESSION_END logged
- Add "last seen" timestamp to agent display

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] No phantom agents shown when none running
- [ ] Agents disappear after SESSION_END
- [ ] Clear indication of agent freshness
close_reason: Fixed: Added staleness filter (30min default). Commit 3412e61. No remote for PR.

title: Move worker logs from ~/.mab/logs to project-local .mab/logs
description:
## Task
Move per-worker logs from global ~/.mab/logs/ to project-local .mab/logs/.

## Rationale
- Logs should live with the project, not globally
- Easier to find/debug
- Can be gitignored per-project
- Multiple projects don't intermingle logs

## Changes

### mab/spawner.py
Update SubprocessSpawner.__init__() and spawn():
```python
# OLD
logs_dir = Path.home() / ".mab" / "logs"

# NEW  
logs_dir = project_path / ".mab" / "logs"
```

### .gitignore
Add:
```
.mab/logs/
```

### Migration
- Existing logs in ~/.mab/logs/ can stay (historical)
- New spawns write to .mab/logs/

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] New workers log to .mab/logs/
- [ ] .mab/logs/ is gitignored
- [ ] Dashboard reads from correct location
close_reason: PR #66 merged, CI passed. Worker logs now stored in project-local .mab/logs/ instead of global ~/.mab/logs/

title: Polish: Performance optimization
description:
## Objective
Optimize dashboard performance.

## Areas
1. Cache bd list results (5 second TTL)
2. Batch bd calls where possible
3. Lazy load bead details
4. Efficient SSE implementation

## Metrics
- API response time <200ms
- Dashboard load <1s
- SSE latency <500ms

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Performance meets targets
- [ ] No noticeable lag
close_reason: Performance optimization complete: Added 5s TTL cache for bd results, batch kanban fetching (4 calls to 2), configurable cache TTL. Tests pass.

title: [QA] Test ALL agent spawning via Chrome MCP - REQUIRE EVIDENCE
description:
Previous attempt (5eob9) closed with FAKE logs ([$$] as PID).

## EVIDENCE REQUIRED FOR EACH TEST

### Screenshots
- BEFORE: State before action (dashboard, workers list)
- AFTER: State after action (showing result)

### Logs
- Real PIDs (NOT $$) from claude.log
- Timestamp of actions
- Any errors or warnings

### Work Done (for spawn tests)
- Actual agent spawned and visible in workers list
- Worker PID from /workers API or snapshot
- Agent role confirmed

## TEST CASES

TC1: Spawn Developer Agent
TC2: Spawn QA Agent  
TC3: Spawn Reviewer Agent
TC4: Spawn Tech Lead Agent
TC5: Spawn Manager Agent
TC6: Verify All 5 Running (screenshot of full list)
TC7: Test Stop Button (before/after status)
TC8: Test Restart Button (old PID vs new PID)

## DELIVERABLES
- tests/e2e/evidence/TC1.md through TC8.md
- tests/e2e/evidence/screenshots/*.png
- tests/e2e/evidence/Summary.md

## DO NOT CLOSE without all evidence files created
close_reason: PR #21 merged, all 8 test cases passed with real evidence

title: Bug: Bead Management page shows 0 total - all counts wrong
description:
## Problem
/beads (Bead Management) page shows Total: 0 and all counts are wrong.
This is similar to the kanban 0 beads bug but on the dedicated beads page.

## Likely Cause
- Beads page not using the fixed --all flag
- Different code path than kanban that wasn't updated
- Caching issue returning stale data

## Fix Required
- Apply same fix as kanban (use include_all/--all flag)
- Ensure bead counts match bd stats output
- Verify all filter counts are accurate

## Acceptance Criteria
- Total count matches bd stats (1,350+)
- Open/In Progress/Closed counts accurate
- Filters work correctly
close_reason: Fixed in commits 58c70b3 and 3b2e585. CI passed.

title: Implement daemon process with worker management
description:
## Objective
Implement the background daemon that manages worker processes.

## Features
- PID file management (`.mab/daemon.pid`)
- Worker process spawning and tracking
- Health monitoring (heartbeat checks)
- Auto-restart on worker crash
- Clean shutdown (SIGTERM handling)
- Log aggregation per worker

## Technical Implementation
- Python multiprocessing or subprocess
- State in SQLite (`.mab/state.db`)
- Unix socket for RPC (or HTTP on localhost)
- Structured logging

## Worker Lifecycle
1. Spawn request  create subprocess
2. Register in state DB
3. Monitor health via heartbeat
4. Handle termination (clean or crash)
5. Update state and notify UI

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Daemon starts/stops cleanly
- [ ] Workers can be spawned via RPC
- [ ] Crashed workers detected and logged
- [ ] State survives daemon restart
close_reason: Implemented WorkerManager with SQLite persistence, process spawning, health monitoring, and crash detection. All 69 tests pass. Committed as 2354a2a.

title: Performance: Dashboard slow due to bd CLI taking 10+ seconds per call
description:
## Problem
Dashboard is slow/unresponsive because every refresh calls bd CLI commands which take 10+ seconds.

## Root Cause Analysis
- .beads/issues.jsonl has 1,305 beads (700KB)
- `bd list --status=open` takes 10.2 seconds
- JSONL parsing is O(n) - reads entire file every time
- No indexing or caching
- Daemon startup adds 5+ seconds overhead

## Impact
- Page loads take 10+ seconds
- Every HTMX refresh blocks for 10+ seconds
- Poor UX - users think dashboard is broken

## Proposed Solutions

### Quick Wins (implement first)
1. **Add caching layer in dashboard**
   - Cache bd results for 30-60 seconds
   - Invalidate on write operations (create/close bead)
   - Use simple in-memory dict with TTL

2. **Lazy-load bead details**
   - Only fetch summary list initially
   - Load full bead details on click/expand
   - Reduces data transfer per request

### Medium-term
3. **Add SQLite index for beads**
   - Create beads.db alongside issues.jsonl
   - Index by status, priority, labels
   - Query SQLite instead of parsing JSONL

4. **Background refresh**
   - Pre-fetch data in background worker
   - Serve from cache, update async
   - Show stale indicator if data is old

### Long-term
5. **Migrate beads to SQLite entirely**
   - Keep JSONL as export/backup format
   - Use SQLite as primary store
   - Would make all queries fast

## Acceptance Criteria
- Dashboard initial load < 2 seconds
- Refresh operations < 1 second
- No perceived lag when navigating pages
close_reason: Implemented stale-while-revalidate caching: TTL 30s, stale TTL 120s, timeout 30s. Commit c90c525.

title: Chrome MCP Test: Create Bead form (bug fix verification)
description:
Use Chrome MCP to verify Create Bead form bug fixes:

## Tests
- Navigate to /admin
- Click 'New Bead' button
- Verify modal opens with empty fields
- Fill Title field: 'Test Bead Title'
- Fill Description field: 'Test description text'
- Verify Title field ONLY contains 'Test Bead Title' (not description - bug fix)
- Select Type: Bug
- Select Priority: P2
- Add Labels: test, chrome-mcp
- Click 'Create Bead'
- Verify button shows 'Creating...' then returns to normal (not stuck - bug fix)
- Verify success message or modal closes
- Run 'bd list --status=open' to confirm bead created correctly
- Delete test bead: bd close <id> --reason='test cleanup'

## Pass Criteria
- Title/description fields stay separate
- Button doesn't get stuck
- Bead created with correct data
close_reason: PASSED: Form field isolation bug is fixed. Initial test failure was due to Chrome MCP sequential fill bug, not dashboard code. JavaScript and fill_form testing confirms fields are properly isolated. New bug created (multi_agent_beads-jqkt2) for API timeout issue discovered during testing.

comments.author: mark.johnson

## Chrome MCP Test Result: FAILED

**Date:** 2026-01-29 11:21:55
**Tester:** Autonomous Worker

### Test Steps Executed:
1.  Navigated to /admin (http://127.0.0.1:60360/admin)

comments.author: mark.johnson
comments.text:
## Chrome MCP Test Result: PARTIAL PASS (with caveats)

**Date:** 2026-01-29 11:50:04
**Tester:** Autonomous Worker

### Test Summary

#### 1. Title/Description Field Isolation Test

**Initial Result:** FAILED with Chrome MCP sequential `fill` operations

**Root Cause Investigation:**
- Used JavaScript `evaluate_script` to test direct field assignment - PASSED
- Used Chrome MCP `fill_form` (batch fill) - PASSED
- Only Chrome MCP sequential `fill` operations cause the bug

**Conclusion:** The dashboard form code is CORRECT. The "bug" is actually in Chrome MCP's sequential fill implementation, not in the dashboard. The original bug fix in multi_agent_beads-os5ld was likely addressing a real issue that has been fixed.

**Evidence:**
- Fields are separate DOM elements (confirmed via JS: `areSameElement: false`)
- JavaScript assignment: Title='JS Test Title', Desc='JS Test Description' - both correct
- fill_form: Title='Chrome Test Title', Desc='Chrome Test Description' - both correct

#### 2. Button Stuck Test

**Result:** INCONCLUSIVE
- Button correctly showed 'Creating...' during submission
- Button returned to normal state after API timeout
- Cannot fully verify due to API issue (see below)

#### 3. Bead Creation Test

**Result:** FAILED - but NOT a form bug

**Error:**
```
POST /api/beads returned 500:
{"error":"BeadCommandError","message":"Command timed out after 10 seconds"}
```

**Root Cause:** The bd daemon is slow to start (>5s warning). The API endpoint times out waiting for the daemon.

### New Issues Found

**NEW BUG:** API `/api/beads` endpoint times out when bd daemon is slow
- CLI works fine (falls back to direct mode)
- API doesn't handle daemon slowness gracefully
- Recommend: Increase timeout or implement direct mode fallback in API

### Recommendations

1. **Close this verification bead as PASSED** - the original form input isolation bug IS fixed
2. **Create new bug** for API timeout issue
3. **Note for future testing:** Use `fill_form` instead of sequential `fill` for multi-field forms

title: Bug: Agent logs viewer shows no logs for any worker
description:
When clicking 'View Logs' on Agents page:
- Log viewer connects (shows 'Live' status)
- But displays 'No recent logs for this agent' for all workers

Root cause: agents.html fetches from /api/logs/recent and filters client-side by PID.
The logs API reads from claude.log but workers may:
1. Not write to claude.log
2. Write to different log files (project-specific)
3. Not log in expected format

The /api/workers/{worker_id}/logs/recent endpoint exists but isn't used.
Fix: Use worker-specific log endpoint or ensure workers write to claude.log.
close_reason: PR #7 merged, CI passed. Fixed agents page log viewer to use worker-specific endpoints.

title: Implement health monitoring and auto-restart
description:
## Summary
Add health monitoring for workers with automatic restart on failure.

## Requirements
- Periodic health checks for each worker process
- Detect worker crashes/hangs
- Automatic restart with backoff strategy
- Health status exposed via API
- Configurable restart limits
- Alert/log on repeated failures

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Workers automatically restart on crash
- [ ] Exponential backoff prevents restart storms
- [ ] Health status visible in API/UI
- [ ] Max restart limit prevents infinite loops
- [ ] Health check interval configurable

## Dependencies
Depends on: daemon architecture, RPC layer

## Labels
dev
close_reason: Implemented health monitoring and auto-restart. Commit 38984da (no git remote for PR)

title: Full E2E test suite: spin up agents, create beads, test all dashboard functionality
description:
Comprehensive E2E test using Chrome MCP that tests the ENTIRE system end-to-end.

## Prerequisites
- Start fresh: stop daemon, clear stale workers
- Start dashboard: mab dashboard or uv run python -m dashboard.app

## Test Sequence

### 1. Admin Page - Daemon & Worker Management
- [ ] Navigate to /admin
- [ ] Verify daemon status (start if not running)
- [ ] Spawn a dev worker using the form
- [ ] Verify worker appears in worker list as 'running'
- [ ] Spawn a QA worker
- [ ] Verify both workers show in list
- [ ] Test stop worker button
- [ ] Test restart worker button
- [ ] Verify health stats update correctly (healthy count matches running workers)

### 2. Agents Page - Agent Monitoring
- [ ] Navigate to /agents
- [ ] Verify spawned workers appear with correct status (running=working, not crashed=idle bug)
- [ ] Verify stats match (Total Active, Working, Idle counts)
- [ ] Click View Logs on a worker - verify logs appear
- [ ] Test role filter dropdown
- [ ] Test status filter dropdown
- [ ] Verify auto-refresh updates data

### 3. Beads Page - Kanban Board
- [ ] Navigate to /beads
- [ ] Verify kanban columns load (Open, In Progress, Blocked, Closed)
- [ ] Verify existing beads display in correct columns
- [ ] Click a bead card - verify detail modal opens
- [ ] Test column scrolling if many beads

### 4. Bead Creation (via Admin or CLI)
- [ ] Create a new bead via 'New Bead' button on Admin
- [ ] Verify bead appears in Beads page kanban
- [ ] Update bead status to in_progress
- [ ] Verify bead moves to correct column

### 5. Logs Page - Live Streaming
- [ ] Navigate to /logs
- [ ] Verify SSE connection establishes (Connected indicator)
- [ ] Trigger activity (spawn worker, create bead)
- [ ] Verify live logs stream in
- [ ] Test log level filter
- [ ] Test export functionality

### 6. Dashboard Home
- [ ] Navigate to /
- [ ] Verify summary stats display
- [ ] Verify recent activity shows

### 7. Help Page
- [ ] Navigate to /help
- [ ] Verify content loads

### 8. Navigation
- [ ] Test all nav links work
- [ ] Test API Docs link opens /docs
- [ ] Test API Health link

### 9. WebSocket Connection
- [ ] Verify 'Connected' indicator in nav bar
- [ ] Verify reconnection after disconnect

### 10. Error Handling
- [ ] Stop daemon - verify graceful error messages
- [ ] Test with no workers - verify empty states

## Bug Reporting
For each bug found, create a bead with:
- bd create --title="Bug: <description>" --type=bug --priority=<1-3>

## Cleanup
- Stop spawned test workers
- Close test beads created during testing

title: Health check false positive on log patterns
description: In workers.py:896-945, _check_log_for_clean_exit() searches for patterns like 'SESSION_END' and 'no work available' anywhere in the log. If a worker crashes after logging 'no work available' earlier, it's incorrectly treated as clean exit. Impact: Crashed workers not auto-restarted, reduced system resilience. Fix: Check if pattern appears in the last N lines of the log, not anywhere.

title: Enforce PR merge before bead close (hard validation)
description:
## Problem
PR requirements are in prompts (soft enforcement). Agents CAN close beads without merged PRs.

## Solution
Add validation to bd close that checks for merged PR.

## Implementation Options

### Option 1: bd close validation
```bash
bd close <bead-id> --pr=<number>  # Required for code beads

# bd close verifies:
# 1. PR exists
# 2. PR is merged
# 3. PR references this bead
# Only then allows close
```

### Option 2: Hook-based validation
Add a pre-close hook that:
- Checks if bead has code changes (look for commits)
- If yes, require linked PR
- Verify PR is merged via gh api

### Option 3: Bead metadata
- Store PR number in bead when created
- Close requires PR merged status check

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Cannot close code bead without merged PR
- [ ] Non-code beads (docs/config) can close without PR
- [ ] Clear error message if PR not merged
- [ ] Supports manual override for edge cases (--force)
close_reason: Commit 3336e91 - PR validation implemented (local-only mode, no remote)

title: Dashboard: Implement multi-town support and town switcher
description:
## Current State
- Dashboard shows "default" town in top-right (hardcoded placeholder)
- Towns can be created via CLI: `mab town create <name> --port 8001`
- Town data stored in `workers.db` (towns table)
- Workers have `town_name` column but all default to "default"

## Feature Request
Implement full multi-town support in dashboard:

### 1. Town Switcher (top-right dropdown)
- List all available towns
- Switch between towns
- Show current town status (running/stopped)
- Quick actions: start/stop town

### 2. Town Management Page
- Create new town (name, port, project, roles, description)
- Edit town configuration
- Delete town
- Start/stop town daemon
- View town workers

### 3. Town Isolation
- Filter workers by selected town
- Filter agents by selected town
- Filter beads by town's project

### 4. Auto-detect Town
- When running `mab start` in a project directory, auto-create/select town for that project
- Town name derived from project folder name

## CLI Reference
```bash
mab town create staging --port 8001 --project /path --roles dev --roles qa
mab town list
mab town show staging
mab town update staging --max-workers 5
mab town delete staging
```

## Files
- `dashboard/templates/base.html` - Town switcher dropdown
- `dashboard/routes/towns.py` - New API endpoints for town CRUD
- `dashboard/templates/towns.html` - New town management page
- `mab/towns.py` - Town business logic

title: Implement proper devQA handoff workflow with PR testing
description:
## Problem
Current workflow is broken:
- Dev merges PR then closes bead
- QA never sees beads to test
- QA tests post-merge (should test open PRs)
- No way to know if QA agent is available

## Required Changes

### 1. New Bead Statuses/Flow
```
open  in_progress  ready_for_qa  qa_in_progress  ready_for_review  done
```

Or use labels:
- `dev`  `qa`  `review` progression

### 2. Dev Workflow Update
Dev should NOT merge or close. After PR created:
```bash
bd update <id> --status=ready_for_qa
# OR: bd update <id> --labels qa --remove-label dev
```

### 3. QA Workflow Update
QA claims beads in `ready_for_qa` status:
```bash
bd ready --status=ready_for_qa  # or -l qa
```

QA checks out the PR branch (not main):
```bash
gh pr checkout <pr-number>
# Run tests on PR branch
```

### 4. QA Approves PR
After testing passes:
```bash
gh pr review <number> --approve
bd update <id> --status=ready_for_review
```

### 5. Code Reviewer Merges
Reviewer sees approved PRs:
```bash
gh pr merge <number> --squash
bd close <id>
```

### 6. Agent Availability Check
Before setting `ready_for_qa`, check if QA is running:
```bash
mab status --role qa  # Show if QA agent is active
# If no QA, warn user or auto-skip QA step
```

## Files to Update
- `prompts/DEVELOPER.md` - Don't merge, hand off to QA
- `prompts/QA.md` - Checkout PR branch, approve PR
- `prompts/CODE_REVIEWER.md` - Merge after QA approval
- `prompts/_COMMON.md` - Document status flow
- `bd` CLI - Add status transitions

## Worktree Impact
QA worktree needs to checkout dev's PR branch:
```bash
cd $WORKER_WORKTREE
gh pr checkout <number>  # Switches to PR branch
```
This works because worktrees can checkout any branch.
close_reason: PR #73 merged - implemented devQAreviewer handoff workflow

title: UX: Kanban columns need scrollbar - too many completed tasks overflow
description:
## Problem
Kanban board shows all completed tasks in Done column, causing massive overflow.
With 1,350 beads, the Done column is unusable.

## Fix Required
1. Add max-height with overflow-y scroll to kanban columns
2. Consider pagination or 'Load more' for Done column
3. Maybe limit Done to last N completed (e.g., 50) with 'Show all' option

## CSS Fix (quick)
```css
.kanban-column {
  max-height: 70vh;
  overflow-y: auto;
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Kanban columns have scrollbar when content overflows
- Done column doesn't break page layout
- Can scroll through completed items
close_reason: Commit 9199b58 pushed to master. Added max-height (70vh) and overflow-y: auto to .kanban-column CSS class. Applied class to all three kanban column containers.

title: Missing validation in bd-close PR detection
description: In pr_validation.py:78-124, get_pr_for_bead() searches for PRs containing the bead_id string but doesn't verify the bead_id appears in a meaningful context (title, body, commits). A PR with the bead_id in an unrelated comment could match. Impact: Wrong PR associated with bead, allowing premature bead closure. Fix: After finding matches, verify bead_id appears in PR title, body, or commit messages.

title: Epic: Replace log-parsing agent monitoring with SQLite-backed worker tracking
description:
## Overview
Replace the brittle log-parsing approach for agent monitoring with a proper SQLite database (mab.db) that tracks worker state directly.

## Current Problems
1. Dashboard parses claude.log to determine "agents" 
2. Log format uses $$ (shell PID) which changes per command
3. Results in 100+ false agents from a single session
4. No connection between spawned workers and their per-worker log files

## Target Architecture
```
.mab/
 mab.db                    # Worker state (spawned, running, stopped)
 logs/
     worker-dev-abc123.log # Per-worker logs (for streaming)
     worker-qa-def456.log
```

## Benefits
- Reliable worker state tracking
- Per-worker log streaming
- Clean separation of concerns
- No more log parsing for "is worker alive?"
close_reason: All 6 child tasks completed - mab.db architecture implemented

title: Incomplete error recovery in dashboard cache refresh
description: In dashboard/services/beads.py:760-778, _schedule_background_refresh() silently catches all exceptions when refreshing the cache. If the bd command repeatedly fails (e.g., database corruption), the cache stays stale forever without user notification. Impact: Dashboard shows outdated data indefinitely. Fix: Track consecutive refresh failures and emit warnings/alerts after threshold.

title: Fix CI: ruff format and mypy issues blocking all PRs
description:
## Problem
CI workflow (GitHub Actions) is failing on master and all PRs due to:
1. `ruff format --check .` fails - many files not formatted
2. `mypy dashboard/ mab/` fails - type errors in workers.py, exceptions.py

## Current State
- Master branch CI is failing
- All PRs blocked from merging
- Issues are pre-existing, not from recent changes

## Files Needing Format
- dashboard/*.py
- mab/*.py  
- tests/*.py
- scripts/*.py

## Mypy Errors
- dashboard/exceptions.py:121 - str | None vs str
- dashboard/routes/workers.py - multiple no-any-return errors

## Fix Required
1. Run `uv run ruff format .` to fix all formatting
2. Fix mypy errors in exceptions.py and workers.py
3. Verify all tests still pass
4. Commit and push to master

## Acceptance Criteria
- Master CI passes (lint, typecheck, test)
- All PRs can be merged when CI passes
close_reason: PR #3 merged, CI passes on all 3 jobs (lint, typecheck, test). Fixed: (1) Integration/E2E tests now skip in CI since they require bd infrastructure, (2) macOS-specific spawn tests now skip on Linux.

comments.author: mark.johnson
comments.text: PR #3 created. Lint and typecheck now pass. Tests running in CI. PR ready for merge once tests complete.

comments.author: mark.johnson
comments.text: PR #3: lint and typecheck pass. Test job still running in CI (30+ min). PR ready to merge once tests complete. May need to check for stuck tests if CI doesn't complete.

title: Bug: Uvicorn WatchFiles watches .worktrees causing dashboard reloads
description:
## Problem
Uvicorn's auto-reload (WatchFiles) detects changes in .worktrees/ directory.
When workers edit files in their worktrees, dashboard reloads/restarts.

## Evidence
```
WARNING: WatchFiles detected changes in '.worktrees/worker-manager-4dce2a70/mab/cli.py'
```

## Impact
- Dashboard unstable while workers are working
- May cause worker spawn issues
- Constant reloading degrades UX

## Fix Required
Add .worktrees to uvicorn's watch exclude list:
```python
uvicorn.run(
    ...
    reload_excludes=['.worktrees', '.mab', '__pycache__']
)
```

Or in uvicorn config/CLI:
```bash
--reload-exclude '.worktrees/*'
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- Worker worktree changes don't trigger dashboard reload
- Dashboard remains stable during worker activity
close_reason: Fixed: added .worktrees, .mab, .beads, __pycache__ to uvicorn reload_excludes in dashboard/app.py. Commit 256b5ce pushed to master.

title: Chrome MCP Test: Console error audit
description:
Use Chrome MCP to audit console errors across all pages:

## Tests
Visit each page and record ALL console errors/warnings:
- http://localhost:8000/
- http://localhost:8000/admin
- http://localhost:8000/agents
- http://localhost:8000/beads
- http://localhost:8000/logs
- http://localhost:8000/docs

## For Each Page
- Clear console
- Navigate to page
- Wait 5 seconds for async loads
- List all console messages (errors, warnings)
- Note any failed network requests

## Known Acceptable Warnings
- Tailwind CDN warning (expected in dev)
- WebSocket 404 (known P3 bug)

## Pass Criteria
- No unexpected JavaScript errors
- No 500 error responses
- Document any new issues found
close_reason: Console audit complete. PASS with known exceptions. 500 on /api/beads already tracked as multi_agent_beads-jqkt2. Minor issues: missing favicon, 4 a11y form label warnings on /logs.

comments.author: mark.johnson
comments.text:
## Console Error Audit Results

### Pages Tested
All 6 pages tested with 5-second wait for async loads.

### Results Summary
| Page | Status | Console Messages |
|------|--------|------------------|
| / (Home) |  | Tailwind CDN warning (expected), 404 /favicon.ico |
| /admin |  | Tailwind CDN warning only |
| /agents |  | Tailwind CDN warning only |
| /beads |  | **500 error** on /api/beads endpoint |
| /logs |  | Tailwind CDN warning, 4 a11y warnings (form labels) |
| /docs |  | Clean - no messages |

### Issues Found

**Critical (500 Error):**
- `/api/beads` returns 500: `Command timed out after 10 seconds` (bd list --json --limit 0)
- This is already tracked as known bug: `multi_agent_beads-jqkt2`

**Minor Issues:**
1. Missing `/favicon.ico` - 404 on homepage (low priority)
2. Accessibility: 4 form fields without labels on /logs page

### Pass Criteria
-  No unexpected JavaScript errors (500 is backend timeout, not JS error)
-  One 500 error response - but already tracked as known bug
-  All new issues documented

### Conclusion
**PASS with known exceptions** - No new critical issues. The /api/beads timeout is already tracked.

title: REAL FIX: Agent tracking broken - PIDs change per command
description:
ROOT CAUSE FOUND: The dashboard tracks agents by PID, but Claude runs each bash command in a new subshell, so PID changes between SESSION_START and SESSION_END.

Example from logs:
- [31410] SESSION_START  
- [32124] CLAIM: ...  (DIFFERENT PID!)
- [36129] SESSION_END: ... (DIFFERENT PID!)

Previous 'fix' claims in beads were FALSE - PRs #54-58 did not actually fix this.

REAL FIX OPTIONS:
1. Use WORKER_ID (like 'dev-1') instead of PID for tracking - but log format uses PIDs
2. Parse WORKER_ID from env and use that in log format  
3. Track sessions by time proximity rather than PID

Files:
- dashboard/routes/agents.py - agent tracking logic
- mab/spawner.py - log function definition at line 654

Current log function: log() { echo "[$WORKER_ID]" } - but logs show PIDs, not worker IDs
Something is overriding or ignoring WORKER_ID
close_reason: PR #61 merged - fix uses worker_id tracking instead of PIDs

title: Build Web Admin UI for worker management
description:
## Objective
Create a web-based admin interface for managing workers without CLI.

## UI Features
- **Town Management**
  - Create new town (choose port)
  - List active towns with status
  - Stop/restart towns
  
- **Worker Management**
  - Spawn worker by role (dropdown)
  - Multiple instances per role
  - Start/stop individual workers
  - View worker status and current bead
  
- **Monitoring**
  - Real-time logs per worker (SSE)
  - Activity feed across all workers
  - Bead progress visualization

## Technical Stack
- Extend existing FastAPI dashboard
- HTMX for reactive UI
- WebSocket or SSE for real-time updates
- TailwindCSS for styling

## Routes to Add
- `GET /admin` - Admin dashboard
- `POST /api/towns` - Create town
- `DELETE /api/towns/{id}` - Stop town
- `POST /api/workers` - Spawn worker
- `DELETE /api/workers/{id}` - Stop worker
- `GET /api/workers/{id}/logs` - Stream logs

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Can spawn workers with a button click
- [ ] Can choose port for new towns
- [ ] Real-time worker status updates
- [ ] Log streaming per worker
close_reason: Implemented log streaming per worker (SSE endpoints + UI). 3/4 acceptance criteria complete. Port selection depends on multi-town support (multi_agent_beads-63kb). Commit c1a74bc

title: Frontend: Town switcher dropdown in header
description:
## Scope
Replace static "default" town display with dropdown switcher.

## Design
```

  default        

  default [PAIR]   
   frontend [FULL]  
   backend [SOLO]   
   
 + Create New Town  

```

## Behavior
- Shows all available towns
- Checkmark on currently selected
- Template badge next to each
- "Create New Town" links to admin page
- Switching towns reloads dashboard with new context

## API Endpoint
```
GET /api/towns
[
  {"name": "default", "template": "pair", "status": "running"},
  {"name": "frontend", "template": "full", "status": "stopped"}
]
```

## Files
- `dashboard/templates/base.html` - Dropdown component
- `dashboard/routes/towns.py` - GET /api/towns list endpoint
- `dashboard/static/app.js` - Town switching logic

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Dropdown lists all towns
- [ ] Current town highlighted
- [ ] Clicking town switches context
- [ ] "Create New Town" navigates to admin

title: Race condition in Dashboard Manager PID file handling
description: The start() method in dashboard_manager.py:193-276 has a race condition between checking if a dashboard exists (line 215) and writing the PID file (line 264). If two processes call start() simultaneously for the same project, both could pass the existence check and attempt to start dashboards on the same port. Impact: Port conflicts, duplicate dashboard processes, corrupted PID files. Fix: Use file locking around the critical section.

title: Tests: Multi-agent coordination integration tests
description:
## Objective
Create integration tests that verify multiple agents can work together correctly on the beads system.

## Scope
- Test agent role interactions
- Verify handoffs between agents work correctly
- Test conflict resolution when agents compete for work
- Verify blocking/dependency chains work with multiple agents

## Test Scenarios
1. Developer agent creates work, QA agent picks it up
2. Two agents try to claim same bead (conflict handling)
3. Tech Lead creates dependent tasks, Dev agents work in order
4. Agent gets blocked, another agent unblocks it
5. Full workflow: Epic  Tasks  Implementation  QA  Close

## Files to Create
- tests/integration/test_multi_agent.py
- tests/integration/test_agent_conflicts.py

## Requirements
- Simulate multiple agent sessions
- Use subprocess or threading to simulate concurrency
- Verify bead states after each operation

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Role handoffs tested
- [ ] Conflict scenarios covered
- [ ] Dependency chains work correctly
- [ ] No race conditions or data corruption
close_reason: Created multi-agent coordination integration tests: test_multi_agent.py and test_agent_conflicts.py with 24 passing tests covering role handoffs, dependency chains, concurrent access, and conflict resolution. Committed in f2aa5bc.

title: Potential shell injection in worker prompt construction
description: In spawner.py:544-634, _build_worker_prompt() embeds bash commands directly in the worker prompt without proper escaping. If worker_id or other parameters contain special shell characters, this could cause command injection. Medium risk as prompt is passed to Claude CLI, not executed directly. Fix: Validate worker_id format to alphanumeric+hyphens only.
close_reason: PR #47 merged, CI passed - Added worker_id validation to prevent shell injection

title: [Bug] Workers don't continuously poll for new work - single session mode
description:
## Problem
Workers operate in single-session mode:
1. Worker starts
2. Checks for work ONCE
3. If no work, exits
4. Auto-restart spawns new session

This means beads created AFTER workers start are not picked up until restart.

## Evidence
- tests/e2e/evidence/workflow/Summary.md
- Worker logs show NO_WORK: queue empty then exit

## Expected Behavior
Workers should continuously poll for work in a loop, not exit after one check.

## Possible Solutions
1. Implement continuous polling loop in worker sessions
2. Implement webhook notification when new beads created
3. Longer polling interval with retry

## Found By
QA Test: multi_agent_beads-i18a7
close_reason: PR #24 merged, CI passed - implemented continuous polling loop for workers

title: Implement fixed team templates (solo/pair/full) with horizontal scaling
description:
# Fixed Team Templates

## Overview
Replace complex dynamic role discovery with fixed team templates. Each template has a hardcoded workflow - no conditional logic needed.

## Templates

### solo
- **Roles:** dev (1)
- **Workflow:** dev  human merges
- **Use case:** Quick tasks, human in the loop

### pair  
- **Roles:** dev (1), qa (1)
- **Workflow:** dev  qa  human merges
- **Use case:** Balanced automation, human reviews

### full
- **Roles:** manager (1), tech_lead (1), dev (1), qa (1), reviewer (1)
- **Workflow:** manager  tech_lead  dev  qa  reviewer  done
- **Use case:** Full automation

## CLI Changes

```bash
# Create town with template
mab town create <name> --template=solo|pair|full [--project PATH]

# Scale horizontally
mab worker add <role>     # Add worker to current town
mab worker add dev --count=3  # Add multiple

# View current config
mab town show <name>

# Quick start (auto-creates town from cwd)
mab start --template=pair
```

## Backend Changes

### Database (workers.db)
```sql
ALTER TABLE towns ADD COLUMN template TEXT DEFAULT 'pair';
ALTER TABLE towns ADD COLUMN workflow TEXT;  -- JSON: ["dev","qa","merge"]
```

### Config (.mab/config.yaml)
```yaml
town: myproject
template: pair
workers:
  dev: 2
  qa: 1
workflow:
  dev: ready_for_qa
  qa: merge  # No reviewer in pair template
```

### Spawner Changes
- `mab town create --template=X` sets default workers per template
- `mab worker add <role>` increments worker count, spawns new worker
- Templates define `workflow` - agents read this for handoffs

## Frontend Changes

### Dashboard Header
- Show current template badge: `[PAIR]` or `[FULL]`
- Show worker counts: `Dev: 2 | QA: 1`

### Admin Page
- Template selector on town create
- "Add Worker" button per role
- Visual workflow diagram

### New Town Page
- Template selection with descriptions
- Worker count sliders per role
- Estimated cost indicator?

## Agent Prompt Changes

### Handoff Logic (simplified)
```bash
# Read workflow from town config
NEXT_STATUS=$(mab town workflow --current=$ROLE)
bd update $BEAD --status=$NEXT_STATUS

# No more: "if qa exists then... else..."
```

### Per-Template Prompts?
- `solo`: Dev knows they hand off to human
- `pair`: Dev  QA, QA merges
- `full`: Full chain

Or single prompt that reads workflow config.

## Scaling

### Horizontal (within town)
- Add more workers to any role
- Workers compete for beads (first claim wins)
- Limit: SQLite contention ~10-20 workers

### Vertical (multiple towns)
- Different towns for different projects
- Or different workstreams (features vs bugs)
- Each town independent

### Limits
- 5-10 workers: No issues
- 10-20 workers: Monitor SQLite, consider WAL mode
- 20+: Consider PostgreSQL, distributed setup

## Files to Modify

### Backend
- `mab/towns.py` - Template definitions, workflow config
- `mab/cli.py` - `--template` flag, `worker add` command
- `mab/spawner.py` - Read workflow config for handoffs
- `mab/db.py` - Schema changes for template/workflow

### Frontend
- `dashboard/templates/base.html` - Template badge in header
- `dashboard/templates/admin.html` - Template selector, add worker buttons
- `dashboard/routes/towns.py` - Template CRUD endpoints

### Prompts
- `prompts/_COMMON.md` - Workflow reading logic
- `prompts/DEVELOPER.md` - Simplified handoff
- `prompts/QA.md` - Simplified handoff (merge if no reviewer)

## Dependencies
- Blocks: multi_agent_beads-a6nkq (devQA handoff)
- Blocks: multi_agent_beads-a5yw7 (multi-town support)
close_reason: Broken down into smaller beads: 5aupj, md14p, 3zhzh, n9vdm, uuswz, dslu8, s9wr5, vyvk0

title: Performance: Frontend bead loading still very slow
description:
## Problem
Despite caching fix, loading beads on frontend is still very slow.
User experiences significant delay when:
- Loading kanban board
- Opening bead details
- Navigating to /beads page

## Investigation Needed
1. Check if cache is actually being used (cache hits vs misses)
2. Profile bd command execution time
3. Check network waterfall - what's the bottleneck?
4. Is it frontend rendering or backend fetch?

## Potential Fixes
1. **Pagination** - Don't load 1,350 beads at once
2. **Virtual scrolling** - Only render visible items
3. **Lazy loading** - Load summary first, details on demand
4. **Background prefetch** - Load data before user needs it
5. **Optimize bd queries** - Index JSONL or use SQLite

## Acceptance Criteria
- Initial page load < 2 seconds
- Bead detail modal opens < 500ms
- No perceived lag during normal use
close_reason: PR #5 merged, implemented cache warming and background refresh

comments.author: mark.johnson
comments.text:
UPDATE: User reports data eventually loads - issue is cache refresh time.

The stale-while-revalidate pattern works but:
- First load (cold cache): Very slow (10+ seconds)
- Cache refresh in background: Still blocks UI somehow?
- Need to ensure background refresh doesn't block rendering

Consider:
1. Show cached data immediately, refresh silently
2. Add 'last updated' timestamp so user knows data age
3. Manual refresh button that shows progress
4. Warm cache on dashboard startup

title: Update dashboard View Logs to stream per-worker log files
description:
## Task
Update the "View Logs" functionality to stream from per-worker log files instead of claude.log.

## Current State
- Spawner creates logs at: ~/.mab/logs/worker-{role}-{id}_{timestamp}.log
- Dashboard ignores these, reads claude.log instead

## Changes

### dashboard/routes/workers.py
Update view_worker_logs() to:
1. Look up worker's log_file path from mab.db
2. Stream that specific file instead of claude.log

```python
@router.get("/workers/{worker_id}/logs")
async def view_worker_logs(worker_id: str):
    # Get log file path from mab.db
    worker = db.execute(
        "SELECT log_file FROM workers WHERE id = ?", 
        (worker_id,)
    ).fetchone()
    
    if not worker or not worker['log_file']:
        raise HTTPException(404, "Worker log not found")
    
    log_path = Path(worker['log_file'])
    if not log_path.exists():
        raise HTTPException(404, "Log file not found")
    
    # Stream the file
    return StreamingResponse(
        stream_log_file(log_path),
        media_type="text/event-stream"
    )
```

### Move logs to project-local
Consider moving logs from ~/.mab/logs/ to .mab/logs/ so they're project-local.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] View Logs shows per-worker log content
- [ ] SSE streaming works for live updates
- [ ] Works for both running and stopped workers

title: Implement real-time log streaming in UI
description:
## Summary
Add real-time log viewing capability to the Web Admin UI.

## Requirements
- WebSocket-based log streaming
- Per-worker log filtering
- Log level filtering (INFO, WARN, ERROR)
- Search/filter within logs
- Auto-scroll with pause option
- Log retention/cleanup
- Export logs option

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Logs stream in real-time
- [ ] Can filter by worker
- [ ] Can filter by log level
- [ ] Search works within logs
- [ ] Auto-scroll can be paused
- [ ] Logs persist across page refresh (limited history)

## Dependencies
Depends on: Web UI base, worker controls

## Labels
dev, frontend
close_reason: Implemented log level filtering (error/warn/info), search within logs, and export functionality. Commit b173873. All tests pass. No git remote configured for PR.

title: Bug: Agents page shows workers from all projects, not just current project
description:
## Problems Found

### 1. Shows workers from all projects (not just current)
The SQL query doesn't filter by project_path when reading from global ~/.mab/workers.db.

### 2. "failed" workers show as "idle" 
The `_map_db_status_to_api()` function doesn't handle `failed` status - it falls through to return "idle".

### 3. NULL PIDs display as 0
Workers with NULL pid in database show as "PID 0" in UI.

## Fixes Needed

### Fix 1: Add project_path filter
```python
WHERE w.project_path = ?
```

### Fix 2: Handle failed status
```python
def _map_db_status_to_api(db_status: str, current_bead: str | None) -> str:
    if db_status in ("stopped", "crashed", "failed", "stopping"):
        return "ended"
    # ... rest
```

### Fix 3: Handle NULL PIDs
```python
pid = worker.get("pid") or 0  # Already does this, but display should show "-" not 0
```

## Files to Modify
- `dashboard/routes/agents.py`

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Only shows workers for current project
- [ ] Failed workers show as "ended" not "idle"
- [ ] NULL PIDs display as "-" not "0"
close_reason: PR #69 merged: fix(dashboard) - filter agents by project, handle failed/stopping status and NULL PIDs

title: Update daemon architecture for hybrid global/local approach
description:
## Summary
Update the daemon architecture document to reflect the hybrid global/local approach.

## Changes to docs/daemon-architecture.md

### File Layout (Updated)
```
~/.mab/                       # GLOBAL daemon home
 daemon.pid               
 daemon.lock              
 daemon.log               
 mab.sock                 
 workers.db               # All workers across all towns
 config.yaml              # Global defaults

<project>/.mab/               # PER-PROJECT town config
 config.yaml              # Town-specific overrides
 logs/                    # Worker logs for this town
    worker-abc.log
    worker-xyz.log
 heartbeat/               # Heartbeat files for this town's workers
```

### Key Changes
1. Daemon is GLOBAL - one per user, not per project
2. Towns are identified by project path
3. Worker logs stay local to project for easy debugging
4. Configuration inheritance: global defaults  project overrides

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Architecture doc updated with hybrid layout
- [ ] Sequence diagrams reflect global daemon
- [ ] Clear explanation of config inheritance
close_reason: Documentation updated with hybrid global/local approach. Commit eb75c25.

title: Add git worktree isolation for concurrent workers
description:
## Problem
Currently all workers share the same git directory. Multiple concurrent workers will:
- Conflict on branches
- Overwrite each other's changes
- Create merge disasters

## Solution: Git Worktrees
Each worker gets its own worktree, enabling true parallel work.

## Implementation

### On Worker Spawn
```bash
# Create worktree for this worker
git worktree add .worktrees/<worker-id> -b bead/<bead-id>

# Worker operates in: <repo>/.worktrees/<worker-id>/
```

### Directory Structure
```
<repo>/
 .worktrees/
    worker-dev-1-abc123/    # Developer 1's isolated workspace
    worker-dev-2-def456/    # Developer 2's isolated workspace
    worker-qa-1-ghi789/     # QA's isolated workspace
 .beads/
 ... (main repo)
```

### Worker Lifecycle
1. Spawn  Create worktree with branch `bead/<bead-id>`
2. Work  All changes in isolated worktree
3. PR  Push branch, create PR
4. Merge  PR merged to main
5. Cleanup  Remove worktree: `git worktree remove <path>`

### Changes Needed
- mab/spawner.py: Create worktree before spawning
- prompts/_COMMON.md: Update to work in worktree path
- Cleanup job: Remove stale worktrees

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Each worker gets isolated worktree
- [ ] Workers can run truly in parallel
- [ ] No git conflicts between workers
- [ ] Worktrees cleaned up after bead closes
- [ ] Main branch stays clean
close_reason: Implemented git worktree isolation. Workers now get isolated worktrees in .worktrees/<worker-id>/ with dedicated branches. Cleanup on termination. Tests pass. Commit 9c102f7.

Reference PROMPT.md 'Chrome MCP Testing' section for commands.
