title: [QA] Full E2E review: Complete worker workflow verification
description:
## Purpose
Final comprehensive E2E test to verify the COMPLETE worker workflow after all fixes.

## Prerequisites
- Worktree .beads sync fix must be verified (multi_agent_beads-u1v8c closed)
- All prior bug fixes merged (PRs #27, #29, #32, and worktree fix)

## USE CHROME MCP FOR ALL TESTING

## Test Cases

### Phase 1: Environment Setup
#### TC1: Clean State
- Stop all workers, verify clean
- take_screenshot: TC1_clean_state.png

#### TC2: Dashboard Access
- navigate_page: http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin
- take_screenshot: TC2_dashboard.png

#### TC3: Daemon Running
- Verify daemon running with PID
- take_screenshot: TC3_daemon.png

### Phase 2: Spawn ALL 5 Worker Roles
#### TC4: Spawn Developer
- take_screenshot: TC4_dev_spawned.png

#### TC5: Spawn QA
- take_screenshot: TC5_qa_spawned.png

#### TC6: Spawn Reviewer
- take_screenshot: TC6_reviewer_spawned.png

#### TC7: Spawn Tech Lead
- take_screenshot: TC7_tech_lead_spawned.png

#### TC8: Spawn Manager
- take_screenshot: TC8_manager_spawned.png

#### TC9: Verify All 5 Running
- All 5 workers show RUNNING status
- take_screenshot: TC9_all_workers_running.png
- Table: Worker ID | Role | PID | Status

### Phase 3: Workers Persist
#### TC10: Wait 60 Seconds
- All workers still RUNNING after 60s
- take_screenshot: TC10_workers_persist.png

### Phase 4: Create Test Bead
#### TC11: Create Bead via Dashboard
- title='[Test] Full E2E verification bead'
- type=task, priority=P1, labels=dev
- take_screenshot: TC11_bead_created.png
- Note bead ID

### Phase 5: Worker Claims Bead
#### TC12: Monitor for CLAIM (2 min max)
- Watch for bead status = 'in_progress'
- take_screenshot: TC12_bead_claimed.png
- **CRITICAL**: Must pass

#### TC13: CLAIM Event in Logs
- Verify CLAIM event with bead ID
- take_screenshot: TC13_claim_log.png

### Phase 6: Work Execution
#### TC14: WORK_START Event
- take_screenshot: TC14_work_start.png

#### TC15: Monitor Progress
- Watch for work activity
- take_screenshot: TC15_work_progress.png

### Phase 7: Completion
#### TC16: Bead Closed
- Bead status = 'closed'
- take_screenshot: TC16_bead_closed.png

#### TC17: Final State
- No critical errors
- take_screenshot: TC17_final_state.png

## Evidence Directory
tests/e2e/evidence/full_e2e_review/
- TC1.png through TC17.png
- Summary.md with pass/fail table

## Pass Criteria
ALL 17 test cases must PASS, especially:
- TC9: All 5 workers running
- TC10: Workers persist 60s
- TC12: Bead claimed (CRITICAL)
- TC16: Bead closed

## IF ANY CRITICAL TC FAILS
```bash
bd create --title="[Bug] Full E2E review failed: <which TC and why>" --type=bug --priority=1 --labels=dev
```

## Success Criteria
When this bead closes with all TCs passing:
- Worker spawning 
- Worker persistence 
- Bead claiming 
- Work execution 
- Bead completion 
- FULL SYSTEM VERIFIED WORKING

## Cleanup
- Close test bead if not claimed
- Stop all test workers
close_reason: E2E review complete. TC1-11 PASS, TC12 (CRITICAL) FAIL - workers not claiming beads. Bug filed: multi_agent_beads-odnr7

title: Implement global daemon at ~/.mab/
description:
## Summary
Implement the global daemon location at ~/.mab/ to manage all towns from a single process.

## Context
Per user decision, we're using a hybrid approach:
- **Global daemon** (~/.mab/daemon.pid, ~/.mab/mab.sock) - single process managing all towns
- **Per-project config** (.mab/ in each repo) - town-specific settings and logs

## Requirements
- Daemon files live in ~/.mab/:
  - ~/.mab/daemon.pid
  - ~/.mab/daemon.lock  
  - ~/.mab/mab.sock
  - ~/.mab/workers.db (all towns' workers)
  - ~/.mab/daemon.log
- CLI finds global daemon regardless of current directory
- Per-project .mab/ contains:
  - .mab/config.yaml (town-specific overrides)
  - .mab/logs/ (worker logs for this town)

## Changes Needed
- Update Daemon class to use Path.home() / ".mab" by default
- Add town_path parameter for per-project locations
- Update CLI to always connect to global daemon

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Daemon runs from ~/.mab/ regardless of cwd
- [ ] `mab status` works from any directory
- [ ] Per-project .mab/config.yaml respected
- [ ] Worker logs written to project's .mab/logs/
close_reason: Implemented global daemon at ~/.mab/ - commit fb68c20

## Objective
Review all prompts for completeness and accuracy.

5. Workflow is unambiguous

- QA doesn't write production code
- Tech Lead doesn't do prioritization
- Manager doesn't make architecture decisions

title: Update spawner to write worker state to mab.db
description:
## Task
Modify SubprocessSpawner and TmuxSpawner to register workers in mab.db.

## Changes to mab/spawner.py

### On spawn():
```python
# After successful process creation
db.execute("""
    INSERT INTO workers (id, pid, role, status, project_path, worktree_path, 
                        worktree_branch, log_file, started_at)
    VALUES (?, ?, ?, 'running', ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
""", (worker_id, pid, role, project_path, worktree_path, branch, log_file, now))

db.execute("""
    INSERT INTO worker_events (worker_id, event_type, timestamp)
    VALUES (?, 'spawn', ?)
""", (worker_id, now))
```

### On terminate():
```python
db.execute("""
    UPDATE workers SET status = ?, stopped_at = ?, exit_code = ?
    WHERE id = ?
""", (status, now, exit_code, worker_id))

db.execute("""
    INSERT INTO worker_events (worker_id, event_type, message, timestamp)
    VALUES (?, 'terminate', ?, ?)
""", (worker_id, reason, now))
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Workers appear in mab.db when spawned
- [ ] Worker status updates on terminate
- [ ] Events logged to worker_events table
- [ ] Existing spawn/terminate functionality unchanged
close_reason: PR #63 merged, CI passed. SubprocessSpawner and TmuxSpawner now write worker state to mab.db on spawn/terminate.

title: Chrome MCP Test: End-to-end workflow - daemon to worker to bead
description:
Use Chrome MCP to test complete end-to-end workflow:

## Workflow Test
1. Start at /admin
2. Start daemon (if not running)
3. Verify daemon status is RUNNING
4. Create a test bead via New Bead form
5. Navigate to /beads - find the test bead
6. Navigate to / (kanban) - find test bead in Ready column
7. Spawn a worker (Developer role)
8. Navigate to /agents - verify worker appears
9. Check /logs for worker activity
10. Stop the worker
11. Stop daemon
12. Clean up: close test bead

## Pass Criteria
- Full workflow completes without errors
- State is consistent across all pages
- No console errors throughout
close_reason: Chrome MCP E2E test complete. Found 3 bugs (form input, /beads rendering, worker spawn DB schema). See comments for details.

comments.author: mark.johnson
comments.text:
## E2E Chrome MCP Workflow Test Results

### Workflow Steps Completed:
 Step 1: Navigate to /admin - PASSED
 Step 2-3: Daemon verification - PASSED (RUNNING, PID 33398)
 Step 4: Create test bead via form - FAILED (form input bug, used CLI workaround)
 Step 5: /beads page - PARTIAL (API returns data, UI shows 0 beads initially)
 Step 6: Kanban board - PASSED (after manual refresh)
 Step 7: Spawn worker - FAILED (database schema bug - missing column)
 Step 8: /agents page - PASSED (shows 6 agents)
 Step 9: /logs page - PASSED (advanced filtering, live streaming)
 Steps 10-11: Stop worker/daemon - SKIPPED
 Step 12: Clean up test bead - PASSED

### Bugs Found:
1. **Form input field isolation** - Chrome MCP fill() concatenates values across fields
2. **/beads page rendering** - Shows 0 beads but API returns data (needs refresh)
3. **Worker spawn database schema** - table workers missing last_restart_at column (NEW BUG: multi_agent_beads-r2z0k)

### Console Errors:
- No critical JS errors
- Tailwind CDN warning (expected in dev)
- Accessibility: 4 form fields without labels

### Pass Criteria Assessment:
 Full workflow did NOT complete without errors (worker spawn blocked)
 State is mostly consistent across pages (some refresh needed)
 No console errors throughout (only warnings)

title: Dashboard: Implement SSE log streaming
description:
## Objective
Create Server-Sent Events endpoint for real-time log streaming.

## File to Create
- dashboard/routes/logs.py

## Endpoints
GET /api/logs/stream    - SSE endpoint for live logs
GET /api/logs/recent    - Last N log entries

## Implementation
- Use `tail -f` subprocess for log following
- Yield events as SSE format
- Filter by role/bead if requested

## SSE Format
data: {"timestamp": "...", "role": "developer", "event": "CLAIM", "message": "..."}

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SSE connection stays open
- [ ] New log entries stream in real-time
- [ ] Handles log file rotation gracefully
close_reason: Implemented SSE log streaming endpoints. Commit 72c67de. All 46 tests pass.

title: Implement missing mab CLI commands (spawn, list, config, logs)
description:
## Problem
Tests are failing because several CLI commands don't exist:
- `mab spawn` - spawn workers (11 tests failing)
- `mab list` - list workers
- `mab config` - show/set configuration
- `mab logs` - view worker logs

## Test Failures (11 total)
From `uv run pytest tests/test_mab_cli.py tests/test_daemon.py`:
- test_spawn_help
- test_spawn_invalid_role_rejected
- test_list_help
- test_list_when_daemon_not_running
- test_restart_daemon_not_running
- test_config_show_no_init
- test_logs_help
- test_logs_when_no_workers
- test_status_command_stopped (daemon state issue)
- test_status_json_output (daemon state issue)
- test_stop_not_running_error (daemon state issue)

## Required Implementation
Add to mab/cli.py:
1. `@cli.command() def spawn()` - spawn worker by role
2. `@cli.command() def list()` - list active workers  
3. `@cli.command() def config()` - configuration management
4. `@cli.command() def logs()` - view/stream logs

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 11 failing tests pass
- [ ] `mab --help` shows all commands
- [ ] Commands connect to daemon via RPC
close_reason: Implemented spawn, list, config, logs commands. All 77 tests pass. Commit d779e1b

title: Chrome MCP Test: Main dashboard and kanban board
description:
Use Chrome MCP to test main dashboard (/) functionality:

## Tests
- Navigate to http://localhost:8000
- Verify page title contains 'Kanban Board'
- Verify header, Refresh Now button, Dependencies button visible
- Click Refresh Now - verify network request fires
- Click Dependencies - verify view toggles
- Press Escape - verify returns to kanban
- Verify kanban columns (Ready, In Progress, Done) visible
- Click a bead card - verify detail modal opens
- Press Escape - verify modal closes
- Check console for errors

## Pass Criteria
- All elements visible and clickable
- No JavaScript errors in console
- Network requests succeed (200 status)
close_reason: Chrome MCP test PASSED: Page title OK, nav/buttons visible, Refresh fires network request (200), Dependencies toggle works, Escape returns to kanban, columns (Ready/In Progress/Done) visible. Only errors: favicon 404 (minor), Tailwind CDN warning (expected in dev). No bead cards to test modal (empty board). All acceptance criteria met.

title: [Bug] High worker crash/restart rate - 191 restarts, 36 crashed
description:
## Problem
Dashboard shows abnormally high crash/restart counts for workers.

## Evidence from QA Test:
- Crashed: 36 workers
- Total Restarts: 191
- This is from a single session/day of testing

## Impact
- Workers are cycling frequently
- May be affecting work throughput
- Dashboard shows mostly CRASHED status

## Needs Investigation
- Why are workers crashing so frequently?
- Are they crashing or just exiting cleanly?
- Is the CRASHED status accurate or misleading?

## Found By
QA Test: multi_agent_beads-i18a7 (workflow_v2)
close_reason: PR #28 merged - fix distinguishes clean exits from crashes in health check

title: Design daemon architecture for worker lifecycle management
description:
## Objective
Design the daemon architecture that will manage worker lifecycle.

## Research Required
- Study how beads daemon works (`.beads/daemon.pid`, RPC pattern)
- Evaluate: Unix sockets vs HTTP for local RPC
- Consider: SQLite for state vs in-memory with persistence

## Deliverables
- Architecture document with:
  - Daemon process design
  - RPC protocol specification
  - State management approach
  - Health check and auto-restart strategy
  - Graceful shutdown handling
- Sequence diagrams for key flows

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Clear daemon lifecycle documented
- [ ] RPC protocol defined
- [ ] State persistence strategy chosen
- [ ] Addresses multi-town isolation
close_reason: Design document complete: docs/daemon-architecture.md. All acceptance criteria met: daemon lifecycle documented, RPC protocol defined, SQLite state persistence chosen, multi-town isolation addressed.

title: Implement RPC communication layer
description:
## Summary
Create RPC communication between CLI commands and the background daemon.

## Requirements
- Unix socket or TCP-based RPC
- Message protocol for commands (spawn worker, stop worker, get status)
- Request/response pattern with timeouts
- Error handling for daemon not running
- Connection pooling for performance

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] CLI can send commands to daemon
- [ ] Daemon responds with structured data
- [ ] Graceful handling when daemon offline
- [ ] Timeout handling for stuck requests
- [ ] Protocol documented

## Dependencies
Depends on: daemon process architecture

## Labels
dev, architecture
close_reason: RPC implementation complete. Created mab/rpc.py with RPCClient (sync, connection pooling) and RPCServer (async). Integrated into daemon with status/shutdown/worker handlers. 35 tests pass. Protocol documented. Commit be55d2d. Note: Blocked by multi_agent_beads-xky1 (global daemon location) but RPC layer is path-agnostic and fully functional.

title: Missing timeout on RPC connection pool reuse
description: In rpc.py:224-242, RPCClient._get_connection() reuses pooled connections without checking how long they've been idle. A connection idle for hours could be closed by the server, causing the next RPC call to fail with a cryptic error instead of reconnecting. Impact: Intermittent RPC failures requiring retry, degraded user experience. Fix: Add connection age tracking and max idle time threshold.

title: Bug: Agents page shows crashed workers as active (working/idle)
description:
Critical data inconsistency:
- Admin page correctly shows 5 workers as CRASHED, 1 as STOPPED
- Agents page shows same workers as 2 'working' and 4 'idle'

Root cause in agents.html line 260:
```js
status: worker.status === 'running' ? 'working' : 'idle'
```
This maps ANY non-running status to 'idle', including 'crashed'.

Fix: Check for crashed status and either filter out crashed workers or show them with a 'crashed' status indicator.
close_reason: Fixed in commit bab5bb5 - agents page now correctly shows crashed/stopped worker status

title: Daemon health check shows worker count as 0 (TODO)
description: In daemon.py:367, get_status() has a TODO comment indicating worker count is hardcoded to 0 instead of reading from workers.db. Impact: Dashboard and CLI show incorrect worker counts, making it impossible to monitor system health. Fix: workers_count = self._worker_manager.count_running() if self._worker_manager else 0

title: Fix: Worktrees not excluded from uvicorn file watcher
description:
WatchFiles is detecting changes in worker worktrees (.worktrees/*) causing dashboard reload spam.

Root cause: reload_excludes patterns missing glob syntax.

Fix: Change patterns from '.worktrees' to '.worktrees/*' etc.

Branch ready: fix/worktree-watch-exclude
